The Nation Institute Oral History Collection on Alger Hiss

This interview was conducted by Albert Ruben on April 19, 2001. In this interview Edith Tiger describes her friendship with Alger Hiss. She explains that she met Hiss in 1968 when she was working at the National Emergency Civil Liberties Committee, and Hiss came into the office to sell stationery. She later came to know him more closely in 1976 after the passage of the Freedom of Information Act, when she assisted him with the coram nobis petition to overturn his conviction. She also talks about her friendship with his first wife Priscilla and his son Tony.
